title: Quick, Draw!
description: In this multi-part coding challenge, I take a closer look at the Quick, Draw! dataset and create a simple node API to "replay" drawings of rainbows and cats using p5.js.

parts.title: Part 1 - Replay a Drawing of the Dataset

timestamps.title: Introducing today's topics: the Quick, Draw! dataset
The data is the pixel paths with timing information
Have server host a p5 sketch
Write a function to load the drawing
Loop through all the paths in the drawing
Loop through points within the strokes
Reset the strokeIndex to zero to draw a new cat
Enjoy a whole bunch of cats!

parts.title: Part 2 - Load Drawings using the Quick, Draw API

timestamps.title: The API Google group is no longer available
Add the API key to the URL query string

codeExamples.title: Quick, Draw! - Part 1
codeExamples.description: This code demonstrates how to create a simple node API to "replay" drawings of rainbows and cats.

codeExamples.title: Quick, Draw! - Part 2
codeExamples.description: The API is no longer available, so a JSON file with one cat is loaded instead.

links.title: Quick, Draw! API
links.description: The Quick Draw Dataset is a collection of 50 million drawings across 345 categories, contributed by players of the game Quick, Draw!.

links.title: Doodle Classifier
links.description: In this series, I build a "doodle classifier" using the Google "Quick, Draw!" dataset and my JavaScript neural network library.

links.description: I cover the basic steps for building a RESTful API with Node.js.
